required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Genetic Biomarkers Associated With Child Language Development in Taiwan
clinical_study.official_title: Genetic Biomarkers Associated With Child Language Development in Taiwan

collaborator.agency: Ministry of Science and Technology, Taiwan

brief_summary.textblock: A study of the relation between genetic biomarkers and child language development in Taiwan.

detailed_description.textblock: The interaction between gene and environment (GÃ—E) can be a very complicated process that influences child development. As a pilot study of child development biomarkers, this study investigates genes related to child language development and language disorder.

primary_outcome.description: Bayley Scales of Infant and Toddler Development (Scores from 0 to 140, higher scores mean a better outcome.)

primary_outcome.measure: Scores of cognitive function (2 y/o to 6 y/o)
primary_outcome.description: Wechsler Preschool and Primary Scale of Intelligence (Scores from 0 to 200, higher scores mean a better outcome.)

primary_outcome.measure: Scores of cognitive function (6 y/o to 16 y/o)
primary_outcome.description: Wechsler Intelligence Scale for Children (Scores from 0 to 200, higher scores mean a better outcome.)
Test of Nonverbal Intelligence-Fourth Edition (Scores from 0 to 60, higher scores mean a better outcome.)
Peabody Picture Vocabulary Test-Revised (Scores from 0 to 124, higher scores mean a better outcome.)
Preschool Language Impaired Scale(PLS)/Language Impaired Scale(LS) (PLS: Scores from 0 to 65, higher scores mean a better outcome. LS: Scores from 0 to 73, higher scores mean a better outcome.)
Comprehensive Developmental Inventory for Infants and Toddlers (Higher scores mean a better outcome.)
Microarray (Use Axiom Genome-Wide TWB 2.0 Array Plate (TWB 2.0) to analyze SNPs of disease-related biomarkers.)
Whole-Exome Sequencing (Use Burrows-Wheeler Aligner (BWA) 85, Samtools86, Picard, Genome Analysis Toolkit (GATK) to screen out the variant discovery and genotyping.)

secondary_outcome.description: Assessment of Preschool Children's Participation (Scores from 0 to 45, higher scores mean a better outcome.)
Children Assessment of Participation and Enjoyment and Preferences for Activity of Children (Higher scores mean a better outcome.)
Functional Independence Measure for Children (Scores from 18 to 126, higher scores mean a better outcome.)
Pediatric Quality of Life Inventory TM (Scores from 0 to 102, higher scores mean a better outcome.)

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria of Healthy Child:
- Age 2-18 y/o
- Agree to sign informed consent
Exclusion Criteria of Healthy Child:
- Central nervous system disease
- Neuromuscular Disorders
- Congenital Abnormality
- Genetic Disease
- Dysesthesia
- Hearing Impairment
Inclusion Criteria of Child with language disorder:
- Patients with Language Disorder
- Age 2-18 y/o
- Agree to sign informed consent
Exclusion Criteria of Child with language disorder:
- Hearing Impairment
Inclusion Criteria of Adult:
- His or her child participated in this study, and gene abnormality was found.
